answerText: equilibrium constant [accept Kc ("k-c" or "k-sub-c") or Keq ("k-e-q" or "k-sub-e-q")][10] The slope of these plots is minus the equilibrium constant. For a solution of a macromolecule and a ligand that binds to it, it graphs the ratio of the bound to free ligand as a function of total concentration of free ligand.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Virginia A - Kentucky A | 20 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The reaction quotient is a generalized form of this quantity whose log is linear with one over T according to the van't Hoff equation. For 10 points each: [10] Name this constant equal to the concentrations of products divided by the concentrations of reactants once the forward and reverse reactions are proceeding at the same rate.
